programmes.show_description: The cops are called to an incident at a petrol station. There's a complicated domestic dispute about missing teeth. A disgruntled drunk targets a security guard's nether regions.
French thriller about a dangerous infatuation. When Élodie and her family move to a peaceful suburb, their new neighbour seems charming. But his mask soon slips. In French/subs. (Ep1)
...Productions Presents: BAFTA and IFTA nominated short film with Aidan Gillen. When a faded 80s pop star performs in Belfast, he learns that one of his songs now has a dark significance.
Bel Aire: Can Gordon Ramsay get two brothers to work through their problems and save their failing New York diner?
From the peak of his powers to his most controversial decision - how Blair took Britain to war in Iraq. With contributions from Blair, Bill Clinton and leading opponents of the war. (Ep2)
...Ross Edgley: Ross's muscles start breaking down and his pee turns brown. Melting glaciers and a hurricane threaten his epic swim. Can the RAF and the amazing northern lights help? (Ep3)
Some extra brunch as Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer host the food and chat show.
Dodger sets out to prove that Smithy is corrupt. Vicky's confidence is crushed. And McQueen family members return as a series of 'what if' scenarios play out during a high-stakes situation.
Another chance to watch yesterday's new episode, with Kelvin Fletcher in Dictionary Corner. Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host.
The Days of Wine and Neuroses: Robin proposes to Rebecca and wants to marry her when he gets out of jail, but she gets cold feet. Frasier's hooked on the new karaoke machine.
Wedding Bell Blues: Robin hires a music star to sing at his wedding to Rebecca, who's forgotten her cold feet, but Sam's request makes her change her tune about the marriage.
I'm Getting My Act Together and Sticking It in Your Face: Rebecca struggles to come to terms with the fact that she's broken off her marriage to Robin.
Humm Vac: Marie and Debra have a housekeeping war after Ray gets sucked into buying a cutting-edge vacuum cleaner.
The Canister: Tempers flare when Marie accuses Debra of not returning a borrowed canister that holds sentimental value - but Debra insists that she's already given it back.
Net Worth: Debra's angry when Ray contributes $1000 to his friends' hare-brained scheme to open a go-kart business without consulting her.
The Show Where Diane Comes Back: When Diane visits Seattle, Frasier is torn between his feelings for her and his resentment from when she ditched him at the altar.
A Word to the Wise Guy: Maris needs Niles's help, and he thinks it's a chance to get back together. But he has to gain a favour from a shady character in order to assist her.
Look Before You Leap: Frasier suggests that everyone celebrates the leap year by trying something daring - but, as usual, his plans go awry.
High Crane Drifter: It's a bad day for American café society as a disgruntled Frasier has his favourite table at Café Nervosa taken over by a rude man.
Thunderdome: It's make or break for the Virginia business strategy. A motorbike legend is ready to sell some high-octane stock. And a rare Growler toy is very old and very odd!
Channel 4's midday news summary.
Ford Mustang: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to Kent to fix up a rusty 1965 Ford Mustang for a surprise reveal in front of 10,000 people at London's O2 Arena.

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In Brighton, Henry Cole salvages a kid's scooter from the junk in recycler Cat's sea containers. Simon O'Brien constructs the largest corkscrew that valuer Ronnie has ever seen.
Another chance to catch yesterday's new episode, with Kelvin Fletcher in Dictionary Corner. Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host.
Lee Juggurnauth heads to south-east Spain around the Costa Cálida to help Trevor and Mel find a dream holiday home. Will any of Lee's five fabulous options hit the spot?

programmes.show_name: A New Life in the Sun
programmes.show_description: There are build problems at Stretch and Rachael's Portuguese reno. Can David and Lane sniff out more business at their French emporium? Will Rachel save the Spanish ranch?
The new run continues. Steve and Andrew host the week's second visit at Cae Court Hotel in Bridgend, where the B&Bers raise a tostada to a brilliant Spanish brekkie.
The new run continues. In Bradford, Jason plans a menu of Yorkshire's finest but keeps throwing his efforts in the bin! After postcode palaver, have Jason's chances 'bin' and gone? (Ep2/5)

programmes.show_name: New: A Place in the Sun
programmes.show_description: Mandy and Andy lap up Lake Como's stunning shores to find the perfect holiday home for £130k. Will an apartment that they've already seen online live up to their expectations in real life?
Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.
That exploring-a-new-city excitement... But how can we enjoy a beautiful city break without breaking the bank? Jasmine Harman reveals how to land cheap flights and bag free luggage. (Ep4)
The drama continues as David Thewlis stars in a real-life story of pollution and criminal convictions that exposes how water companies have polluted our natural resources for so long. (Ep2)
What do the Goggleboxers think of Black Mirror, Gladiators and The Apprentice? Also, Britain's Got Talent, The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up To Cancer and Casualty.
On the show this time, The Masked Singer, Love Is Blind, Gladiators, Steal, Bargain Holiday Secrets, The Floor and ITV News (Larry the Cat).
A car sale on social media turns into a knife-point carjacking and a high-speed car chase. In Sheffield, the hit-and-run death of an elderly man takes a disturbing twist. (Ep4)
The final twelve solve a complex maths game to escape from a maze. Then the top eight compete against each other in a mind-bending memory game, for a place in the final four. (Ep5/6)
Bridget Christie and Chloe Petts muse over the week's news with Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker.
Weakened by the Iraq war, Blair's forced out of office by his own party. Blair seeks to build a new legacy on a global scale but is repeatedly forced to defend his time in Number 10. (Ep3)
Carl and Brianha bring the French Riviera to Bognor Regis, with lasers and a smoke machine. Justin and Karen do fine dining. And is Mark and Lisa's curry too hot for their guests to handle?
Some extra brunch as Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer host the food and chat show.
Kirstie and Phil catch up with Paul and his American bride Alissa in Windsor, and Malcolm and Jenny in Wiltshire.
Another chance to catch yesterday's new episode, with Kelvin Fletcher in Dictionary Corner. Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host.
Sam Time Next Year: Sam's back trouble threatens his annual Valentine's Day get-together with Lauren. Frasier and Lilith try to merge their therapy groups.
Crash of the Titans: Rebecca tries to buy the lease for the bar from John Hill, but Sam gets wind of her plans.
It's a Wonderful Wife: Norm becomes increasingly paranoid when Vera gets a job working above the bar at Melville's restaurant. Lilith helps Frasier celebrate his birthday.
Let's Fix Robert: Marie gets Robert's ex and his police partner Judy together in an effort to understand why her son can't seem to commit to a relationship.
Say Uncle: When Ray realises that his kids would rather spend time with their Uncle Robert than with him, he decides to do something about it.
Separation: Debra's shocked when her parents split up.
Chess Pains: Frasier buys an expensive chess set and challenges his dad to a game. Martin wins easily, again and again...
Crane vs. Crane: Niles and Frasier take opposing sides in a court battle over the competency of eccentric millionaire Harlow Stafford.
Police Story: Frasier sets his sights on a police officer who, unbeknown to him, has a crush on his dad.
Where There's Smoke There's Fired: Frasier begins a campaign to woo the new radio station owner, Texas multi-millionaire Big Willy, so that his show will be syndicated nationwide.
Auburned Out: Mike gambles on a 1935 Auburn car that's been in a barn for two decades. The guys are on shaky ground in Iowa. Dave reveals the results of Mike's biggest investment.
Channel 4's midday news summary.
JCB Digger: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to Essex to restore a tatty old JCB for carpenter Kev. But rejigging the digger is a bigger job than they figured...

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In Gloucestershire, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet motocross fan Tom. Henry upcycles Porsche wheel rims into stools. Simon makes an extraordinary lamp from old copper piping.
Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Kelvin Fletcher in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.
Jacqui and Michael have always dreamed of owning an Italian holiday home in a village in Abruzzo's mountains. Craig Rowe shows them what £70k can buy.

programmes.show_name: A New Life in the Sun
programmes.show_description: Rachel and her brother open their ranch for guests. David and Lane take drastic action at their emporium. Stretch and Rachael finish their renovation.
The new run continues. The B&Bers visit Shaun and Sarah's glampsite in Aberystwyth, where a pair of resident diddy donkeys steal the show - and plenty of hearts.
The new run continues. In Bradford, Gaby hopes that her Sardinian soirée, singing son, cocktails, party tricks and dolce vita dinner will sweeten the deal with her guests. (Ep3/5)

programmes.show_name: New: A Place in the Sun
programmes.show_description: Sally and Lee see what treats Tenerife has to offer in Costa Adeje for £450k, from a place that would leave you with a tan like a zebra to a gorgeous Moorish duplex giving paradise vibes.
Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.

programmes.show_name: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programmes.show_description: ...List It: Kirstie and Phil meet Heather and Tim, whose seven-acre home near Edinburgh has a dysfunctional layout. Tim wants somewhere more rural but Heather wants to stay put.
The drama concludes as David Thewlis leads in a real-life story of pollution and criminal convictions that exposes how water companies have polluted our natural resources for so long. (Ep3)
There's a singing star this time and a sax player too. A couple of yachties. And an ex-copper from Essex seeks an alpha male fit to be a king.
